intro: Bellis azorica, commonly known as the Azorean daisy, is a flowering plant native to the Azores, a group of islands in the North Atlantic. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies, sunflowers, and thistles. The plant features small, white petals surrounding a yellow center, forming a composite flower head. It typically grows in moist, shaded areas and has a low-growing habit. Bellis azorica is valued for its ornamental appeal and its role in local ecosystems.
